instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Trackpad electrically compatible alternatives (if any?)
threads.message:
For the purpose of differential testing of a board here; does the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> trackpad have electrical compatibility to any other models like the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> or <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ?


Regards, Paul.
